docs.title: Amazon Quick Suite Starter Kit
docs.text: Automated deployment of Amazon Quick Suite using AWS IAM Identity Center as an identity provider.

docs.title: What is Amazon Quick Suite?
docs.text:
Amazon Quick Suite is an agentic AI-powered digital workspace that answers your questions and turns those answers into actions using agentic teammates for research, business insights, and automation. The service requires no machine learning expertise to use.

Quick Suite helps you make better decisions faster by unifying AI agents for research, business insights, and automation. You can connect to diverse data sources, create interactive dashboards, build intelligent automations, and get immediate insights through natural language conversations with AI agents.

QuickSight Service Name

Amazon Quick Suite is the new name for Amazon QuickSight. The underlying AWS service still uses QuickSight APIs, service principals, and console pages. This is why you'll see quicksight in IAM policies, CLI commands, and CloudFormation resources. See the Amazon Quick Suite documentation for API references.

docs.title: What This Starter Kit Provides
docs.text:
This starter kit automates the deployment and management of Quick Suite with:

  • Infrastructure as Code - AWS CDK deployment of Quick Suite with AWS IAM Identity Center
  • User Management - CLI tools for managing users and groups
  • Monitoring - Tools to track usage and costs
  • Best Practices - Pre-configured security and governance settings

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
New to this project? Here's your path:

  1. Getting Started - Deploy Quick Suite in ~15 minutes
  2. Operator Tools - Manage users and monitor usage
  3. Cleanup - Remove resources when done

For architecture details, see the blog post.

docs.title: Role Mappings
docs.text:
This starter kit uses AWS IAM Identity Center groups mapped to Quick Suite roles:

Identity Center Group Quick Suite Role Notes QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN Admin Pro Created automatically during deployment QUICK_SUITE_ENTERPRISE Author Pro Create using the manage-users operator tool QUICK_SUITE_PRO Reader Pro Create using the manage-users operator tool

For role capabilities and pricing, see Amazon Quick Suite Pricing.

Using Your Own Admin Group

If you have an existing admin group synced from your federated identity provider, you can configure the deployment to use it instead of creating QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN. See Getting Started for configuration options.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
• Getting Started - Deployment guide
  • Operator Tools - Management runbooks
  • Cleanup Instructions - Remove resources
  • Architecture Details - Blog post

docs.title: Support
docs.text: For issues or questions, please open an issue on GitHub.

docs.title: Cleanup and Deletion
docs.text: This guide explains how to properly remove your Amazon Quick Suite deployment to avoid ongoing costs.

docs.title: Cleanup Process
docs.text:
To remove all resources:

  1. Delete the Quick Suite subscription - Use the Amazon QuickSight console or AWS CLI command aws quicksight delete-account-subscription to delete the subscription. This must be done before destroying the stack.

  2. Destroy the CDK stack - Run npm run cdk destroy to remove the Lambda function, IAM roles, and other infrastructure.

  3. Remove IAM Identity Center groups (optional) - Use the IAM Identity Center console or AWS CLI to delete groups created during setup if no longer needed.

docs.title: Important Notes
docs.text:
The custom resource handler does not automatically delete the Quick Suite subscription during stack deletion to prevent accidental data loss. You must delete the subscription separately before running npm run cdk destroy.

AWS IAM Identity Center groups are not automatically deleted and will remain in your Identity Center instance after stack deletion.

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
After cleanup, you may want to:

  • Review your AWS billing dashboard to confirm all charges have stopped
  • Remove any remaining CloudWatch log groups if desired
  • Delete the CDK bootstrap stack if you're not using CDK for other projects

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide walks you through deploying Amazon Quick Suite with AWS IAM Identity Center.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• AWS CLI configured with appropriate credentials
  • Node.js 18+ and npm
  • Python 3.12+
  • uv package manager
  • Docker (for Lambda bundling)
  • AWS CDK CLI: npm install -g aws-cdk

Region Restrictions

Amazon Quick Suite AI capabilities are only available in certain AWS regions. Check the Quick Suite FAQs for current regional availability.

docs.title: Step 1: Install Dependencies
docs.text: npm install

docs.title: Step 2: Configure Deployment (Optional)
docs.text: You can customize the deployment via cdk.json context or command line parameters:

docs.title: Configuration Options
docs.text:
IDENTITY_CENTER_INSTANCE_ARN (optional) Existing AWS IAM Identity Center instance ARN. If not provided, a new instance will be created.

QUICK_SUITE_ACCOUNT_NAME (default: QuickSuiteStarterKit) Display name for your Quick Suite account.

Important

  • End users must type this name when signing in - choose wisely!
  • Cannot be changed after account creation
  • Must be globally unique across all AWS accounts
  • Length: 1-62 characters
  • Must start with a letter or digit
  • Can contain letters, digits, and hyphens
  • Cannot end with a hyphen

QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN_EMAIL (default: admin@example.com) Email address for Quick Suite admin notifications. Please choose a real email to get important updates concerning your account.

QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN_GROUP_NAME (default: QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN) Name of the AWS IAM Identity Center group for Quick Suite administrators. This group is automatically created during deployment if it does not exist and is mapped to the Admin Pro role.

docs.title: Example Configuration
docs.text:
cdk.jsonCommand Line 
{
  "context": {
    "IDENTITY_CENTER_INSTANCE_ARN": "arn:aws:sso:::instance/ssoins-xxxxx",
    "QUICK_SUITE_ACCOUNT_NAME": "MyCompanyQuickSuite",
    "QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN_EMAIL": "quicksuite-admin@mycompany.com",
    "QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN_GROUP_NAME": "QuickSuiteAdmins"
  }
}

npm run cdk deploy \
  -c IDENTITY_CENTER_INSTANCE_ARN=arn:aws:sso:::instance/ssoins-xxxxx \
  -c QUICK_SUITE_ACCOUNT_NAME=MyCompanyQuickSuite \
  -c QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN_EMAIL=quicksuite-admin@mycompany.com \
  -c QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN_GROUP_NAME=QuickSuiteAdmins

docs.title: Step 3: Bootstrap AWS Account
docs.text:
If you haven't already bootstrapped your AWS account for CDK:

npx cdk bootstrap

docs.title: Step 4: Deploy Infrastructure
docs.text:
npm run cdk deploy

This deployment will:

  1. Create or use your existing AWS IAM Identity Center instance
  2. Deploy Quick Suite infrastructure using a custom resource Lambda
  3. Create the QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN group automatically (required for setup)

Do Not Access Quick Suite Yet

After deployment completes, do not navigate to https://us-east-1.quicksight.aws.amazon.com yet. You must create an admin user first (Step 6), otherwise you won't be able to sign in.

Using Existing Admin Group

If you have an existing admin group synced from your federated identity provider to AWS IAM Identity Center, you can modify the CDK code to use that group name instead of QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN.

docs.title: Step 5: Enable Email OTP for API-Created Users
docs.text:
CRITICAL: Required Before Creating Users

This is a one-time manual step that you must complete before creating users via the operator tools. Without this setting, users created via API will not receive the invite to sign in.

Steps:

  1. Open the IAM Identity Center console
  2. Choose Settings
  3. Choose the Authentication tab
  4. In the Standard authentication section, choose Configure
  5. Check the Send email OTP checkbox
  6. Choose Save

This setting allows users created via API to receive a verification email on their first sign-in attempt, enabling them to set their password. Learn more in the AWS IAM Identity Center documentation.

docs.title: Step 6: Create Your First Admin User
docs.text:
CRITICAL: Do This Before Accessing Quick Suite

You must create an admin user before attempting to access Quick Suite. Without a user in the QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN group, you cannot sign in.

Navigate to the operator tools directory:

cd operator_tools

docs.title: Create Your First Admin User
docs.text:
uv run manage-users create-user \
  --username admin \
  --email admin@example.com \
  --given-name Admin \
  --family-name User \
  --group QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN

docs.title: Complete User Email Verification
docs.text:
After you create a user, they must verify their email and set up authentication in AWS IAM Identity Center:

  1. Email Verification: The user will receive an email with subject "Your administrator has requested you to verify your email address". They should follow the instructions in the email.

  2. First Sign-In to IAM Identity Center: The user enters their username and sets up MFA.

  3. Set Password: The user creates their password.

Password Requirements

Passwords must be at least 8 characters and contain uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters.

docs.title: Step 7: Access Quick Suite
docs.text:
Now you can access Quick Suite:

  1. Navigate to https://us-east-1.quicksight.aws.amazon.com (replace us-east-1 with your deployed region if different)
  2. Enter your Quick Suite account name (e.g., QuickSuiteStarterKit)
  3. You'll be redirected to AWS IAM Identity Center login
  4. Sign in with your admin user credentials

You're Ready!

Your Quick Suite environment is now fully configured and ready to use!

docs.title: Step 8: Verify Deployment
docs.text:
Check your deployment:

uv run monitor account-summary

docs.title: Adding More Users
docs.text:
To add users with different roles (Author Pro or Reader Pro):

  1. Create the additional groups: uv run manage-users setup-groups
  2. Map groups to Quick Suite roles: uv run manage-users assign-groups-to-quick-suite
  3. Create users with appropriate groups

See the User Management Runbook for detailed instructions.

docs.title: Other Resources
docs.text:
• Monitoring Runbook - Track usage
  • Architecture Details - Blog post

docs.title: Operator Tools
docs.text: Post-deployment management tools for Amazon Quick Suite.

docs.title: User Management Runbook
docs.text:
Manage AWS IAM Identity Center users and groups, and assign them to Quick Suite roles.

Use this runbook for:

  • Creating groups and users
  • Batch user provisioning
  • Assigning groups to Quick Suite roles
  • Managing user group memberships

docs.title: Monitoring Runbook
docs.text:
Monitor Quick Suite usage, users, and account status.

Use this runbook for:

  • Viewing account summaries
  • Listing users and their roles
  • Checking group memberships
  • Tracking active vs inactive users

docs.title: Monitoring Runbook
docs.text: Guide for monitoring Quick Suite usage and users using the monitor tool.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: The monitor tool provides visibility into Quick Suite users, groups, and account status.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Quick Suite deployed and configured
  • Access to AWS account with Quick Suite permissions

docs.title: account-summary
docs.text:
Displays Quick Suite account overview with user counts and role distribution.

uv run monitor account-summary

For all available options:

uv run monitor account-summary --help

docs.title: list-users
docs.text:
Lists all Quick Suite users with their roles and status.

uv run monitor list-users

For all available options:

uv run monitor list-users --help

docs.title: list-groups
docs.text:
Lists all Quick Suite groups.

uv run monitor list-groups

For all available options:

uv run monitor list-groups --help

docs.title: list-group-members
docs.text:
Lists all members of a specific Quick Suite group.

uv run monitor list-group-members --group-name QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN

For all available options:

uv run monitor list-group-members --help

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• User Management Runbook
  • Getting Started

docs.title: User Management Runbook
docs.text: Guide for managing AWS IAM Identity Center users and Quick Suite access using the manage-users tool.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
The manage-users tool manages AWS IAM Identity Center users and groups, and assigns them to Quick Suite roles. All operations are idempotent.

Using Custom Group Names

This tool uses default group names: QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN, QUICK_SUITE_ENTERPRISE, and QUICK_SUITE_PRO. If you have custom group names from your federated identity provider, modify the QuickSuiteGroup enum and QUICKSIGHT_ROLE_MAPPING dictionary in operator_tools/src/manage_users.py before using these tools.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Quick Suite deployed via CDK
  • Access to AWS account with AWS IAM Identity Center permissions

docs.title: setup-groups
docs.text:
Creates the Quick Suite pricing tier groups in AWS IAM Identity Center.

Run This Before Adding Non-Admin Users

You must run this command before creating users with QUICK_SUITE_ENTERPRISE or QUICK_SUITE_PRO groups. Without these groups, you cannot assign users to Author Pro or Reader Pro roles.

uv run manage-users setup-groups

Creates:

  • QUICK_SUITE_ENTERPRISE (Author Pro)
  • QUICK_SUITE_PRO (Reader Pro)

Note: QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN is created automatically during deployment.

docs.title: create-user
docs.text:
Creates a single user in AWS IAM Identity Center and optionally assigns them to a group.

uv run manage-users create-user \
  --username johndoe \
  --email john.doe@example.com \
  --given-name John \
  --family-name Doe \
  --group QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN

For all available options:

uv run manage-users create-user --help

docs.title: sync-users
docs.text:
Batch creates or updates users from a JSON file.

uv run manage-users sync-users --file users.json

Example users.json:

{
  "users": [
    {
      "username": "admin.user",
      "email": "admin@example.com",
      "given_name": "Admin",
      "family_name": "User",
      "group": "QUICK_SUITE_ADMIN"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: assign-groups-to-quick-suite
docs.text:
Maps AWS IAM Identity Center groups to Quick Suite roles.

Prerequisites

  • Run setup-groups first to create the groups (if using default group names)
  • Groups must exist in AWS IAM Identity Center before running this command
  • If groups don't exist, the command will fail with an error for each missing group
uv run manage-users assign-groups-to-quick-suite

For all available options:

uv run manage-users assign-groups-to-quick-suite --help

Default Mappings:

See the Role Mappings table for group-to-role assignments.

docs.title: add-user-to
docs.text:
Assigns a user to a Quick Suite group. Automatically removes user from other Quick Suite groups.

uv run manage-users add-user-to \
  --user-id <user-id> \
  --group QUICK_SUITE_ENTERPRISE

For all available options:

uv run manage-users add-user-to --help

docs.title: delete-user
docs.text:
Removes a user from AWS IAM Identity Center.

# By username
uv run manage-users delete-user --username johndoe

# By user ID
uv run manage-users delete-user --user-id <user-id>

docs.title: list-users
docs.text:
Lists all users in AWS IAM Identity Center.

uv run manage-users list-users

docs.title: list-groups
docs.text:
Lists all groups in AWS IAM Identity Center.

uv run manage-users list-groups

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• Monitoring Runbook
  • Getting Started
